subject: Re: [junit] How to skip remaining tests when one test method in a TestCase fails?
msgSnippet: Jim, There s no guarantee of the order in which Java will present the methods to JUnit, and therefore no guarantee of the order in which JUnit will run them.
messageBody:
Jim,

There's no guarantee of the order in which Java will present the methods
to JUnit, and therefore no guarantee of the order in which JUnit will
run them. Others have had similar issues. Two strategies that often
help are:

1) Can you change your tests so that they are independent? This often
helps to make both the tests and the tested code easier to understand.

2) Could you combine your tests into one test method with multiple
asserts? If all of the statements are dependent, this might provide the
behavior you're looking for.

In my own code, I would prefer option #1.

David Saff

cant_jim wrote:
> I'm writing a class (extending TestCase) which tests an object I get
> from a factory method. The first test method asks the Factory for the
> object and subsequent tests methods exercise the returned object.
>
> If any method fails, I know all the remaing ones will fail. How can I
> prevent the subsequent tests from being run? (I assume the test
> methods are invoked in the order the appear in the TestCase.)
>
> Thanks in advance.
>
> Jim Cant
